name: gsm_symbolic
system_prompt:
Given a problem, your task is to answer the question by thinking step-by-step in a clear and specific manner.
Once you have thought about the reasoning process, provide the answer in the following format:
<answer>answer here</answer>
Do not explain your reasoning inside the answer tags, provide only the final answer. When an example is provided, you should strictly follow the format of the output/answer in that example.

results.question: Isabella is trying to decide whether to do her financial planning herself or hire an bookkeeper. If she does it herself, she'll be able to do 8 fewer hours of part-time work, losing $63/hour in missed income. The bookkeeper charges $55. How much more money will she have if she hires the bookkeeper? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

There are currently 10 yellow balls, 25 red balls, and 48 purple balls in the store. yellow balls cost £7, red balls cost £3 and purple balls cost £2. How much will the store have received after all the balls are sold? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
There are 32 girls in the field. If there are 2 times the number of boys in the field, how many kids are in the field? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

William goes to the store to buy some sugar. The normal brand of sugar he buys costs €10 per kg. He had to buy a more expensive brand that costs 40% more since his favorite brand was sold out. He decides to buy a week's worth of sugar and he uses 1 kg of sugar per day. He also decided to buy himself a bagel for €2. How much did everything cost? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
There are 31 girls in the park. If there are 3 times the number of boys in the park, how many kids are in the park? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
Mia can peel 9 carrots a minute and saute 45 carrots in 12 minutes. How long will it take her to peel and saute 180 carrots? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Comet Hale-Bopp orbits the sun every 65 years. Michael's father saw the Comet when he was 41 years old. Michael saw the comet a second time when he was 2 times the age his father was when he saw the Comet. How old was Michael when he saw the Comet for the first time? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
Robert is 19 years old. In 8 years his cousin Mary will be 2 times as old as Robert is now. How old is Mary right now? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
A juggler can juggle 16 balls. 75% of the balls are golf balls, and 75% of the golf balls are yellow. How many yellow golf balls are there? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Ava is required to submit a 156-page dissertation. She already finished writing 3/4 of the dissertation. How many pages does she have left to write? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Mike was a pen pal with 8 people. He stopped being penpals with 2 of them. They each send 4 letters a week that are 6 pages long. He responds in kind. He can write a page every 15 minutes. How many hours does he spend writing a week? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

The Jones family is busy making cupcakes. So far, they've made 7675 cupcakes. They have 2448 lemon cupcakes, 1472 blueberry cupcakes, and some peanut butter cupcakes. How many peanut butter cupcakes have they made? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

At Allan's house, there is 2 times as much grape as corn. He has a total of 85 corn in his house. At the store, Allan bought 71 corn. He also bought some grape, but he bought 40 fewer grape than the 71 corn he just bought. What is the combined total of grape and corn that Allan now has in the house? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

William is selling brownie and cherry pie for a fundraiser. On Tuesday, he sold 28 boxes of brownie and 15 fewer boxes of cherry pie, than on Monday. On Monday, he sold 14 more boxes of brownie than on Tuesday and 26 boxes of cherry pie. If the brownie cost $13 and the cherry pie cost $24, how much did William earn for two days? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
A bacteria infects 7 people. Every day, each infected person infects 7 others. How many people are infected after 3 days? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

A medical center has a capacity of 2400 rooms with 1/3 occupied. Due to the natural disaster, 55 patients are admitted into the medical center each day. Calculate the total number of unoccupied rooms in the medical center after 3 weeks. Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Joseph gets 150 emails a day. 18% of those emails don't require any response. Joseph responds to the rest of them. How many emails does Joseph respond to in a 4 day work week? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Robert watches TV after he finishes his homework every night. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched a 3-hour episode of his favorite show each night. On Wednesday, he watched a few episodes of a 25-minute show. On Thursday, he finished homework early and watched a 3-hour episode and a 55-minute show. On Friday, he got to stay up late for the weekend, so he watched two 5-hour episodes. If he watched 22.416666666666664 hours of TV in all, how many 25-minute episodes did he watch on Wednesday? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
There are 23 girls in the playground. If there are 3 times the number of boys in the playground, how many kids are in the playground? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

In a 80-item quiz, 10% of the questions are geometry, and the rest are equally divided as history and geography questions. If Ava is sure to get 100% of the geometry questions, and half of the history and geography questions correctly, how many points is she sure to get? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

If Robert eats 4 eggs a day for 87 days and then increases it to 6 eggs a day for 76 days, how many dozens of eggs will Robert need for 163 days? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

John has 40 square yards of a banana field. There are 59 bananas per square yard. John can harvest his bananas every 3 months. How many bananas can John harvest within a year? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

On Saturday, Peter wants to exercise for 3 the amount of time he did on Thursday and Monday combined. On Monday he exercised for 27 minutes. On Thursday he exercised for 48 minutes. How many minutes does he have to exercise on Saturday to reach his goal? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Mia has a flower bed that is 147.5 meters long. Mia wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Each plant, including the space it needs around it, requires 1.25 meters of space. Mia already owns 28 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €4 at the store, how much money will Mia spend at the store to fill up her flower bed? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Emma went to the bakery and bought various types of baked goods. She bought 9 dozen donuts which cost $17 per dozen, 7 dozen cookies which cost $87 per dozen, and 9 dozen muffins for $120 per dozen. How much was the total cost? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Maria buys 15 shares of a stock for $40 each. The stock price increases 70% the first year Maria holds it, then decreases 40% in the second year. What is the final value of all Maria's shares? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Sophia is an avid gardener. Yesterday, she received 36 new potted plants from her favorite plant nursery. She already has 11 potted plants on each of the 50 window ledges of her large country home. Feeling generous, she has decided that she will give 5 potted plant from each ledge to friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants will Sophia remain with? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Mary is an avid gardener. Yesterday, she received 45 new potted plants from her favorite plant nursery. She already has 11 potted plants on each of the 55 window ledges of her large country home. Feeling generous, she has decided that she will give 5 potted plant from each ledge to friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants will Mary remain with? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
Sophia is required to submit a 248-page essay. She already finished writing 3/4 of the essay. How many pages does she have left to write? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
A juggler can juggle 40 balls. 50% of the balls are golf balls, and 25% of the golf balls are green. How many green golf balls are there? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Charlotte operates the cash register exactly 3 times as fast as her less-experienced colleague Olivia. Daily, Olivia processes 84 customers. What is the total weekly production for the two if they work all days of the week? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

When the water is cold Bob swims a kilometer in 22 minutes. When the water is warm Bob swims a kilometer in 4 minutes more than 2 times as long. How much longer does Bob take to swim 4 kilometers on a hot day than a cold day? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
Sophia is required to submit a 93-page thesis. She already finished writing 1/3 of the thesis. How many pages does she have left to write? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

A fog bank rolls in from the ocean to cover a city. It takes 155 minutes to cover every 14 miles of the city. If the city is 28 miles across from the oceanfront to the opposite inland edge, how many minutes will it take for the fog bank to cover the whole city? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

If Tom and John have 152 yards of fence between them, and they agree to split it with John getting 70 yards more than Tom, how much is left over for Tom? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
A parasite infects 17 people. Every day, each infected person infects 6 others. How many people are infected after 3 days? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Joseph has 14 tubes of purple paint and 17 tubes of orange paint. John has half as many tubes of purple paint as Joseph, and three times as many tubes of orange paint as Joseph. How many tubes of paint does John have? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

There are 13 students playing badminton and twice that number playing football. There are 15 boys and 15 girls playing table tennis. If each student only participates in one group, how many students are there in total? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Joseph is rolling a 4-sided die. How much more likely is it (expressed as a percentage) that he rolls a number greater than 1 than that he rolls two odd numbers in a row? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Sophia and Emma are sisters from Houston who love collecting signatures from movie stars. During their summer break from school, the sisters spend every afternoon collecting signatures. After 4 weeks, Sophia and Emma compare their autograph books, counting up the number of signatures each sister has collected. Sophia has 30 signatures in her book, and Emma has 57. The sisters have 5 more weeks of summer break, and they decide they want to reach 130 signatures between them by the end of the summer. How many signatures do the sisters need to collect to reach their goal? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Noah hid 5 dozen eggs in the yard for the Easter egg hunt. Benjamin finds 6 eggs. James finds 2 times as many as Benjamin. Liam finds 4 less than James, and Oliver finds 0.5 as many as Liam. How many eggs are still hidden in the yard? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Mia hid 8 dozen eggs in the yard for the Easter egg hunt. Harper finds 9 eggs. Emma finds 2 times as many as Harper. Sophia finds 4 less than Emma, and Oliver finds 0.5 as many as Sophia. How many eggs are still hidden in the yard? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Christopher's dog has 1000 puppies, 200 of which have spots. Robert's dog has 600 puppies, 120 of which have spots. What percentage of all the puppies have spots? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

The Brown family is busy making muffins. So far, they've made 5075 muffins. They have 2078 blueberry muffins, 2573 strawberry muffins, and some peanut butter muffins. How many peanut butter muffins have they made? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

When Sophie watches her brother, she gets out a variety of toys for him. The bag of building blocks has 75 blocks in it. The bin of stuffed animals has 43 stuffed animals inside. The tower of stacking rings has 24 multicolored rings on it. Sophie recently bought a tube of bouncy balls, bringing her total number of toys for her brother up to 206. How many bouncy balls came in the tube? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Olivia was preparing for a lunch party at her house, where she intended to serve vegetable lasagna. She noticed that she was out of plastic plates, so she bought a new package of plates. Later, her husband also bought a package of 14 new plates and gave them to Olivia. While Olivia was making the vegetable lasagna, she used 8 of the plates to sample her vegetable lasagna. Later, when she went to set the table, she had a total of 36 plates. How many plates were in the package that Olivia bought? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Dax went to their backyard to pick some cherries and found half as many caterpillars as wasps in the patch. If there were 140 wasps, calculate the total number of insects in the patch. Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Comet Encke orbits the sun every 55 years. Michael's uncle saw the Comet when he was 24 years old. Michael saw the comet a second time when he was 4 times the age his uncle was when he saw the Comet. How old was Michael when he saw the Comet for the first time? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

Susan is knitting winter wear for her 4 grandchildren. They're quadruplets, so they're all the same size. She wants to make a shawl, sweater, hat, booties, and gloves for each of them. It takes 15 skeins of wool to make a shawl, 6 for a sweater, 8 for a hat, 4 for a pair of booties, and 6 for a pair of gloves. How many skeins of wool will she need to buy? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.

A landscaper works for 2 weeks every month and for 6 days every week. If he gets paid $135 every day, how much does he earn if he works for a year? Give the result as your final answer. Do not include units.
